title: Drive System Design showcases innovative electrified propulsion systems at IAA Transportation 2024
content: Drive System Design (DSD), acquired by Hinduja Tech in 2022, will showcase its latest electrified propulsion systems at IAA Transportation 2024 in Hannover. title: India, China biggest markets of hydrogen powertrain technology in CVs, says Bosch
content: India and China both have a great potential to utilise this new green hydrogen powertrain technology. In India ample green hydrogen is available that can boost this new technology, believes Andreas Dempf, Head of sales and customers for the Mobility Solutions business sector, Bosch. title: Sterlite copper unveils LNG vehicles to achieve net zero carbon emissions

title: ZF Lifetec opens GCC in Hyderabad with EUR 5 million investment; looks to expand global R&D footprint
content: ZF Lifetec has opened a new Global Capability Center in Hyderabad, investing 5 million euros to advance passive safety technology. The facility aims to enhance road safety in India and globally, employing around 220 professionals with plans for future expansion. The Telangana government supports this initiative.

title: Affordable air taxis will soon be a reality, says Modi
content: PM Modi announced that affordable air taxis will soon be available in India, highlighting the transformation of the aviation sector over the past decade. Speaking at the Asia Pacific ministerial conference of civil aviation, he emphasized technological innovations and a trained workforce as key factors for continued growth. The conference concluded with the passing of the 'Delhi Declaration.'

title: China asks its carmakers to keep key EV technology at home
content: China has urged its carmakers to keep advanced EV technology within the country, even as they build factories abroad to avoid tariffs. The Ministry of Commerce advised exporting knock-down kits for final assembly overseas and warned against investments in India. This move aims to protect China's EV industry know-how.

title: Global automotive ER&D spending expected to soar, with focus on digital vehicles, sustainability and AI integration: BCG Report
content: Investment in automotive engineering research and development is expected to grow annually by 8–9% until 2030, reaching up to USD 540 billion. Key drivers include advancements in connected mobility, digital vehicles, sustainability, and artificial intelligence. Automakers face challenges balancing software costs while integrating eco-friendly technology and AI-based systems.

title: Honda partners with IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay for advanced AI research in automated driving technologies
content: Honda has initiated joint research with IIT Delhi and IIT Bombay to advance its Cooperative Intelligence (CI) technology. This collaboration aims to enhance AI technologies for reducing traffic collisions and enabling automated driving. The research will involve real-world testing in India’s complex traffic environments, leveraging the expertise of IIT researchers and students.

title: California passes requirements on carmakers and domestic violence
content: California lawmakers have approved a proposal requiring automakers to enhance protections for domestic abuse survivors using internet-connected cars. The bill mandates carmakers to establish processes for restraining order submissions and to allow drivers to disable location access. Governor Gavin Newsom will decide on the bill by Sept. 30.

title: India has capability to become trusted partner in diversified semiconductor supply chain: PM
